rev.comment: moved text into the "concerns section", but I doubt this belongs here. Also requested sources for this piece of information
rev.diff:
Line 149: Line 149:
Transactions are based on scripts that are contained inside the transactions and are to be executed to 'access the money'. While this increases flexibility of transactions, it does complicate the development of Bitcoin applications.{{Citation needed|date=June 2011}}
Transactions are based on scripts that are contained inside the transactions and are to be executed to 'access the money'. While this increases flexibility of transactions, it does complicate the development of Bitcoin applications.{{Citation needed|date=June 2011}}

==Controversies==
+
===Theft===
On June 13, 2011, a bitcoin user who goes by the forum handle 'allinvain' had his computer hacked and 25,000 bitcoins were stolen roughly worth $467,000 [[USD]].
